2024 年 5 月 12 日星期日 00:31:27 +0000 TED 每日演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks TED - TED.com TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到一些世界领先的思想家和实干家在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲，激发、激发和激发他们的想象力。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 TED 会议上值得传播的想法泰德TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到一些世界领先的思想家和实干家在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲，激发、激发和激发他们的想象力。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 zh知识共享：https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/泰德contact@ted.com https://pl.tedcdn.com/rss_feed_images/ted_talks_main_podcast/video.png TED 每日演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks 144 144 科学技术娱乐设计 TED、TEDTalks、TED 演讲、灵感、创造力、技术演示、教育不非成人的
1 个可以改善女性健康的简单问题 |梅里亚姆·苏古勒梅里亚姆·苏古勒There's a reliable indicator of a woman's future likelihood of cardiovascular disease — but it rarely gets asked about, says obstetrician and researcher Meryam Sugulle. She delves into the role of the placenta in pregnancy, how it can predict health outcomes and the single question that should be worked into routine health screenings. 1 个可以改善女性健康的简单问题 |梅里亚姆·苏古勒There's a reliable indicator of a woman's future likelihood of cardiovascular disease — but it rarely gets asked about, says obstetrician and researcher Meryam Sugulle. She delves into the role of the placenta in pregnancy, how it can predict health outcomes and the single question that should be worked into routine health screenings. https://www.ted.com/talks/meryam_sugulle_1_simple_question_that_could_improve_women_s_health?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:129396 129396 Fri, 10 May 2024 14:27:02 +0000高等教育不00:15:13泰德
停火还有多远？加沙和拉法入侵的最新情况|伊恩·布雷默伊恩·布雷默In an exploration of conflict and diplomacy, president and founder of Eurasia Group and GZERO Media Ian Bremmer joins TED's Helen Walters to unravel the ideological underpinnings, contrasting objectives and humanitarian crises defining the current situation in Gaza. Listen for the latest on Israel’s invasion of Rafah and what happened to the proposed ceasefire deal as well as a dissection of the elusive quest for peace in a region haunted by the specter of war.停火还有多远？加沙和拉法入侵的最新情况|伊恩·布雷默In an exploration of conflict and diplomacy, president and founder of Eurasia Group and GZERO Media Ian Bremmer joins TED's Helen Walters to unravel the ideological underpinnings, contrasting objectives and humanitarian crises defining the current situation in Gaza. Listen for the latest on Israel’s invasion of Rafah and what happened to the proposed ceasefire deal as well as a dissection of the elusive quest for peace in a region haunted by the specter of war. https://www.ted.com/talks/ian_bremmer_how_far_away_is_a_ceasefire_an_update_on_gaza_and_the_rafah_invasion?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:130298 130298 Thu, 09 May 2024 18:12:28 +0000高等教育不00:46:22泰德
气溶胶如何照亮云层并冷却地球莎拉·J·多尔蒂莎拉·J·多尔蒂Here's a conundrum: the same aerosol pollutants that harm human health also help cool the climate, says atmospheric scientist Sarah J. Doherty. Is there a way to clean up the air without warming the planet? Exploring the unintended consequences of reducing air pollution, she makes the case for a better understanding of marine cloud brightening — or intentionally adding sea salt aerosols to clouds over the ocean, which could reflect sunlight back into space and potentially reduce global warming.气溶胶如何照亮云层并冷却地球莎拉·J·多尔蒂Here's a conundrum: the same aerosol pollutants that harm human health also help cool the climate, says atmospheric scientist Sarah J. Doherty. Is there a way to clean up the air without warming the planet? Exploring the unintended consequences of reducing air pollution, she makes the case for a better understanding of marine cloud brightening — or intentionally adding sea salt aerosols to clouds over the ocean, which could reflect sunlight back into space and potentially reduce global warming. https://www.ted.com/talks/sarah_j_doherty_how_aerosols_brighten_clouds_and_cool_the_planet?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:129956 129956 Thu, 09 May 2024 14:46:18 +0000高等教育不00:12:19泰德
欢迎来到音频计算机的世界 |贾森·鲁戈洛贾森·鲁戈洛In an exclusive preview of unreleased technology, designer and inventor Jason Rugolo unveils an entirely new kind of computer you can talk to like a friend. This "audio computer" — which can augment the sounds around you, translate conversations in real time, naturally respond to your voice and more — promises to shake up how we use our devices. It's shown publicly for the first time ever on the TED stage.欢迎来到音频计算机的世界 |贾森·鲁戈洛In an exclusive preview of unreleased technology, designer and inventor Jason Rugolo unveils an entirely new kind of computer you can talk to like a friend. This "audio computer" — which can augment the sounds around you, translate conversations in real time, naturally respond to your voice and more — promises to shake up how we use our devices. It's shown publicly for the first time ever on the TED stage. https://www.ted.com/talks/jason_rugolo_welcome_to_the_world_of_audio_computers?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:130025 130025 Wed, 08 May 2024 14:57:03 +0000高等教育不00:13:01泰德
为什么美国政治崩溃了——以及如何修复它？安德鲁·杨安德鲁·杨The electoral system in the United States needs a redesign, says political reformer Andrew Yang. Exposing the flaws of a system built on poor incentives, he proposes a cost-effective overhaul inspired by primary elections already working in places like Alaska and advocates for ranked-choice voting, where voters can choose candidates in order of preference regardless of party, stemming the influence of extreme ideologies.为什么美国政治崩溃了——以及如何修复它？安德鲁·杨The electoral system in the United States needs a redesign, says political reformer Andrew Yang. Exposing the flaws of a system built on poor incentives, he proposes a cost-effective overhaul inspired by primary elections already working in places like Alaska and advocates for ranked-choice voting, where voters can choose candidates in order of preference regardless of party, stemming the influence of extreme ideologies. https://www.ted.com/talks/andrew_yang_why_us_politics_is_broken_and_how_to_fix_it?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:129699 129699 Tue, 07 May 2024 14:30:19 +0000高等教育不00:10:35泰德
美国教师短缺——解决办法如下|小兰迪·瑟里古奇小兰迪·瑟里古奇How much should we invest in teachers, and what should new investment actually involve? Education innovator Randy Seriguchi Jr. suggests the US should create a "G.I. Bill" for teachers, with a particular emphasis on uplifting Black male professionals. He shares a model of this idea in action through community partnerships in San Francisco, which provide aspiring teachers with graduate school tuition, subsidized housing, personalized fit assessments and more. "If we truly want to elevate this profession to inspire new, diverse talent to join us, we have to improve both the personal and professional experiences associated with teaching," says Seriguchi.美国教师短缺——解决办法如下|小兰迪·瑟里古奇How much should we invest in teachers, and what should new investment actually involve? Education innovator Randy Seriguchi Jr. suggests the US should create a "G.I. Bill" for teachers, with a particular emphasis on uplifting Black male professionals. He shares a model of this idea in action through community partnerships in San Francisco, which provide aspiring teachers with graduate school tuition, subsidized housing, personalized fit assessments and more. "If we truly want to elevate this profession to inspire new, diverse talent to join us, we have to improve both the personal and professional experiences associated with teaching," says Seriguchi. https://www.ted.com/talks/randy_seriguchi_jr_the_us_has_a_teacher_shortage_here_s_how_to_fix_it?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:128249 128249 Mon, 06 May 2024 14:55:18 +0000高等教育不00:11:21泰德
你的伴侣是“那个人吗？”错误的问题 |乔治·布莱尔-韦斯特乔治·布莱尔-韦斯特Marrying for love is a relatively recent phenomenon for humanity, and we still don't fully understand what it means for building successful relationships, says author and psychiatrist George Blair-West. Drawing from his extensive experience working with couples, he shares four questions every couple should ask themselves before tying the knot — and highlights surprising findings on how the way marriage starts impacts if it ends.你的伴侣是“那个人吗？”错误的问题 |乔治·布莱尔-韦斯特Marrying for love is a relatively recent phenomenon for humanity, and we still don't fully understand what it means for building successful relationships, says author and psychiatrist George Blair-West. Drawing from his extensive experience working with couples, he shares four questions every couple should ask themselves before tying the knot — and highlights surprising findings on how the way marriage starts impacts if it ends. https://www.ted.com/talks/george_blair_west_is_your_partner_the_one_wrong_question?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:127674 127674 Fri, 03 May 2024 14:44:49 +0000高等教育不00:15:28泰德
美国如何摧毁年轻人的未来|斯科特·加洛韦斯科特·加洛韦In a scorching talk, marketing professor and podcaster Scott Galloway dissects the data showing that, by many measures, young people in the US are worse off financially than ever before. He unpacks the root causes and effects of this "great intergenerational theft," asking why we let it continue and showing how we could make it end. (Note: This talk contains mature language.)美国如何摧毁年轻人的未来|斯科特·加洛韦In a scorching talk, marketing professor and podcaster Scott Galloway dissects the data showing that, by many measures, young people in the US are worse off financially than ever before. He unpacks the root causes and effects of this "great intergenerational theft," asking why we let it continue and showing how we could make it end. (Note: This talk contains mature language.) https://www.ted.com/talks/scott_galloway_how_the_us_is_destroying_young_people_s_future?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:129805 129805 Thu, 02 May 2024 15:00:42 +0000高等教育不00:18:33泰德
如何治理人工智能——即使它很难预测 |海伦·托纳海伦·托纳No one truly understands AI, not even experts, says Helen Toner, an AI policy researcher and former board member of OpenAI. But that doesn't mean we can't govern it. She shows how we can make smart policies to regulate this technology even as we struggle to predict where it's headed — and why the right actions, right now, can shape the future we want.如何治理人工智能——即使它很难预测 |海伦·托纳No one truly understands AI, not even experts, says Helen Toner, an AI policy researcher and former board member of OpenAI. But that doesn't mean we can't govern it. She shows how we can make smart policies to regulate this technology even as we struggle to predict where it's headed — and why the right actions, right now, can shape the future we want. https://www.ted.com/talks/helen_toner_how_to_govern_ai_even_if_it_s_hard_to_predict?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:129460 129460 Wed, 01 May 2024 14:50:34 +0000高等教育不00:11:12泰德
工人们在自然灾害后重建社区 |萨凯特·索尼萨凯特·索尼As climate change leads to more and more natural disasters, a group of workers is showing up at one site after another to rebuild and repair. Labor organizer Saket Soni tells the stories of Resilience Force — the group of mostly immigrant workers restoring homes after hurricanes, floods and fires — and describes the unexpected bonds developing between the residents whose lives have been turned upside down and the laborers helping put things back together.工人们在自然灾害后重建社区 |萨凯特·索尼As climate change leads to more and more natural disasters, a group of workers is showing up at one site after another to rebuild and repair. Labor organizer Saket Soni tells the stories of Resilience Force — the group of mostly immigrant workers restoring homes after hurricanes, floods and fires — and describes the unexpected bonds developing between the residents whose lives have been turned upside down and the laborers helping put things back together. https://www.ted.com/talks/saket_soni_the_workers_rebuilding_communities_after_natural_disasters?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:128041 128041 Wed, 01 May 2024 14:48:47 +0000高等教育不00:12:55泰德
我成为在澳大利亚划船最快的人的史诗般的旅程 |邦妮·汉考克邦妮·汉考克What challenges lie ahead of a staggering 12,700-kilometer paddle around the entire continent of Australia? Crocodiles and sharks were just the beginning, says Ironwoman Bonnie Hancock. Reflecting on her remarkable feat of becoming the fastest person to paddle around Australia, she shares lessons on perseverance, resilience and finding meaning in life's toughest moments.我成为在澳大利亚划船最快的人的史诗般的旅程 |邦妮·汉考克What challenges lie ahead of a staggering 12,700-kilometer paddle around the entire continent of Australia? Crocodiles and sharks were just the beginning, says Ironwoman Bonnie Hancock.
